description.value:
Trigger A creature walks onto the illusory floor

Effect The triggering creature falls through the illusory floor and takes falling damage (typically @Damage[20[bludgeoning]] damage). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Grab an Edge] reaction to avoid falling. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Climb] the walls (@Check[type:athletics|dc:20|traits:action:climb]) or Grab an Edge is @Check[type:reflex|dc:20|traits:action:grab-an-edge].

stealth.details: (trained; or 0 if the illusory floor is dispelled)

details.description: The floor in this chamber is an illusion, which conceals a 40-foot drop to the true floor below. Additionally, the area beneath the floor is magically silenced-no sound is audible within nor does sound leave this space.
details.disable: Succeeding on a Perception check against the Stealth DC of 21 (including the check to find the trap) disbelieves the illusory floor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to dispel the illusory floor; dispel magic (2nd level; counteract DC 20) to dispel the magical silence
